Setting Journal File Options

To perform this procedure, you must first select the project database or project you want to configure. The project database or project must also be associated with a configuration file.

To set journal file options:

  1. Select Admin | Configure Project. The Configure Project dialog box appears with the General tab active.

  2. If not already selected, select the Show Advanced Options check box.

  3. Select Journal File beneath Security. The Journal File pane on the right appears. The values that display for each option are the settings that are currently defined in the configuration file associated with the project database or project.

  4. Select one of the following options:
    • Do not keep a journal file
    • Keep a journal named 'journal.vcs' in each archive directory
    • Keep a journal file named: enter a filename. If you do not specify a path with the file name, Version Manager places the journal file in the archive directory. This option tells Version Manager to keep a single journal file for all of the archives in a project.


  5. Click OK if you are finished defining options, or click Apply to save the settings and continue to define other options.
